column2: This chapter contains content to do with the mathematics of viruses and epidemiology

column1: Why is Mathematical Modelling so important? (Coronavirus Flashcards)
What are the common mathematical models for epidemics? (Coronavirus Flashcards)
What is the SIR Model? (Coronavirus Flashcards)
What are some common modifications to the SIR model? (Coronavirus Flashcards)
What is the difference between a Agent-based models (ABM) and compartmental models? (Coronavirus Flashcards)
What is the difference between a Stochastic and Deterministic Model? (Coronavirus Flashcards)
How can mathematical modelling be used to help model the effects of vaccination on a population? (Coronavirus Flashcards)
Why do assumptions play a crucial role in the mathematical modelling of the spread of a disease? (Coronavirus Flashcards)
What can we learn, even from overly simplistic, mathematical models of the spread of diseases? (Coronavirus Flashcards)
What are the benefits of computational based models? (Coronavirus Flashcards)
